availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Stanton Pierce Bryan (Oldham County, Kentucky, teacher and physician)

body.p: Oldham County, Kentucky, school teacher and physician. Kentucky native. Married to Adelaide Thomas Bryan. Father of Bettie Bryan, Rosa Bryan, and Bertha B. Bryan. School teacher in Oldham County, Kentucky, in 1850. Physician in Oldham County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Oldham County in 1860. Physician in Oldham County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, Division, p. 128A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, p. 902.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, p. 172A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, Brownsboro, p. 17A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Oldham County, KY, July 1863, p. 203.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 20182.
"Dr Stanton Pierce Bryan (1827-1894)," Find A Grave, Memorial 82687230, accessed March 11, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/82687230.
